intro: Doliocarpus paucinervis, commonly known as the few-veined sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with few veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. Its bark is thick and often fissured, providing a distinctive appearance. Doliocarpus paucinervis is adapted to humid, lowland environments and plays a role in local ecosystems.
